ETYMOLOGY: From Old French librairie 'collection of books', from Latin libraria 'bookshop', from liber 'book'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A building or room containing a collection of books, periodicals, and sometimes films and recorded music, for use by the public or members of an institution.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 存放书籍、期刊以及有时包括电影和录制音乐等资料的建筑物或房间，供公众或机构成员使用。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I spent the whole afternoon studying at the public library.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我在公共图书馆学习了一个下午。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A collection of books or other literary materials, especially one owned by a private person.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 个人所藏的书籍或其他文学资料的集合。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He has an impressive personal library of over a thousand books.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他拥有一千多本书的令人印象深刻的个人藏书。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Computing) A collection of pre-written functions, routines, or resources (such as code or data) that a program can use.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (计算机) 存储在文件中的子程序、例程或资源的集合（如代码或数据），可供其他程序使用。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The programmer used a graphics library to create the animation.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 程序员使用了一个图形库来创建动画。
